{{also|Appendix:Variations of "wo"}} ==English== {{wikipedia}} ===Alternative forms=== * {{l|en|whoa}} ===Etymology 1=== Variant of {{m|en|who}}. ====Interjection==== {{en-interj}} # {{n-g|A falconer's call to a [[hawk]].}} # {{n-g|A call to cause a [[horse]] to slow down or stop; [[whoa]].}} ===Etymology 2=== Variant of {{m|en|woe}}. ====Noun==== {{en-noun|~}} # {{obsolete spelling of|en|woe}} #* '''1815''', Philip Freneau, ''A collection of poems, on American affairs and a variety of other subjects'', page 82[http://books.google.com/books?id=BAkUAAAAIAAJ&pg=PA82]: #*: Such feeble arms, to work internal '''wo'''! #* {{w|Hannah More}} #*: But if there was a competition between a sick family and a new broach, the broach was sure to carry the day. This would not have been the case, had they been habituated to visit themselves the abodes of penury and '''wo'''. ===Anagrams=== * {{anagrams|en|a=ow|'ow|ow}} [[Category:English two-letter words]] ---- ==Acehnese== ===Verb=== {{head|ace|verb}} # to [[go]] [[home]] ===References=== * 2007. [http://archive.phonetics.ucla.edu/ The UCLA Phonetics Lab Archive]. Los Angeles, CA: UCLA Department of Linguistics. ---- ==Dongxiang== ===Etymology=== Compare {{cog|peh|wa}}, perhaps from {{inh|sce|xgn-pro|*bü-|t=to [[be]]}}, see {{cog|mn|бий}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|sce|/wo/|[wo]}} ===Verb=== {{sce-verb}} {{term-label|sce|defective|copular}} # to [[be]] ## {{n-g|existential copula}} ##: {{ux|sce|Eqie guanjinde nie sizi '''wo''', nie basi '''wo'''.|Once upon a time '''there was''' a lion and a tiger.}} ## {{n-g|equitive copula}} ##: {{ux|sce|Bi shi er dui nie bawan, yi dui bawan shi jiu Rejie '''wo''', san dui bawan shi nie halao Remi '''wo'''.|I was the bigshot of the second team, the bigshot of the first team '''was''' Rejie and the bigshot of the third team '''was''' one ugly Remi.}} ## {{n-g|adjectival copula}} ##: {{ux|sce|Ene shihoude sumulase hunnerei '''wo''' dei.|If I think [about it] now, it''''s''' funny.}} # {{n-g|in possessive constructions with the [[possessor]] in [[dative]]}} #: {{ux|sce|Ene ghualade nie ghoni '''wo'''.|These two '''had''' a sheep.}} # {{lb|sce|after {{m|sce|-zhi}}}} {{n-g|forming the progressive tense}} #: {{ux|sce|Bi ene agvinni nanbangiede nie jian wafande sauzhi '''wo'''.|I live ['''am''' living] in a one bedroom house at the south of the village.}} ===Usage notes=== * Usually combined with the Chinese copula {{m|sce|shi}} which is placed between two terms while ''wo'' follows the second. Either of them or even both can be omitted but both being present is usually the most common setup. ===Synonyms=== * {{l|sce|shi}} * {{l|sce|wei}} * {{l|sce|enbe}} ===Antonyms=== * {{l|sce|pushi}} * {{l|sce|u}} ===Derived terms=== * {{l|sce|-zho}} - contraction of {{m|sce|-zhi}} ''wo''. {{catlangname|sce|defective verbs}} ---- ==Ewe== ===Pronoun=== {{head|ee|pronoun}} # [[them]] # [[they]] ---- ==German== ===Etymology=== With a widespread dialectal shift from ''-ā-'' to ''-ō-'', from {{inh|de|gmh|wā}}, {{m|gmh|wār}}, from {{inh|de|goh|wār}}, {{m|goh|hwār}}, from {{inh|de|gem-pro|*hwēr}}, {{m|gem-pro|*hwar}}. Ultimately from {{der|de|ine-pro|*kʷis}}, whence also {{m|de|wer}}. Cognate with {{cog|en|where}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/voː/}} * {{audio|de|De-wo.ogg|Audio}} * {{rhymes|de|oː}} ===Adverb=== {{head|de|adverb|cat2=interrogative adverbs}} # {{lb|de|interrogative}} [[where]] {{gloss|at what place}} #: {{ux|de|'''Wo''' bist du?|'''Where''' are you?}} # {{lb|de|relative}} [[where]] {{gloss|at or in which place or situation}} #: {{ux|de|Ich kenne einen Laden, '''wo''' solche Sachen verkauft werden.|I know a shop '''where''' such things are sold.}} # {{lb|de|relative|somewhat|informal}} [[when]], [[that]] {{gloss|on which; at which time}} #: {{ux|de|Das war der Tag, '''wo''' wir uns kennen gelernt haben.|That was the day '''when''' we got to know each other.}} # {{lb|de|indefinite|colloquial}} [[somewhere]] {{gloss|in or to an uncertain or unspecified location}} #: {{ux|de|Ich wär gern '''wo''', wo's wärmer ist.|I'd like to be '''somewhere''' where it's warmer.}} ====Usage notes==== * The temporal use of ''wo'' (meaning “when”) is sometimes frowned upon in formal standard German. There is a tendency to use a preposition + relative pronoun instead: ''Das war der Tag, '''an dem''' wir uns kennen gelernt haben.'' (“That was the day ''on which'' we got to know each other.”) Nevertheless, this usage is very common in spoken German and is also widely acceptable in writing, particularly after adverbs, where the only alternative would be the archaic {{m|de|da}}: ''Jetzt, '''wo''' ich es weiß, wird mir alles klar.'' (“Now ''that'' I know, it all becomes clear to me.”) Compare {{cog|fr|où|t=where}}, the temporal use of which is perfectly standard. ===Conjunction=== {{head|de|conjunction}} # {{lb|de|colloquial}} [[when]] #: '''''Wo''' ich mich umgedreht hab, haut der mir unvermittelt eine rein.'' #:: '''When''' I turned around, he just abruptly punched me in the face. ====Usage notes==== * This usage is exclusively colloquial and would be considered inappropriate in a formal text. ====Synonyms==== * {{l|de|als}} ===Pronoun=== {{de-pronoun}} {{rfv|de|"dialectal and widely ... Alemannic" means it's Alemannic and something else (Swabian or Bavarian?) but not Standard High German.}} # {{lb|de|relative|dialectal|nonstandard}} [[who]], [[whom]], [[which]], [[that]] #: {{ux|de|Ich bin der, '''wo''' das kann.|I'm the one '''who''' can do that.}} #* '''1979''', Margret Weiler, [https://books.google.de/books?id=D70DAAAAMAAJ&q=leute+wo+sich&dq=leute+wo+sich&hl=de&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwjW1omio_jiAhVv1qYKHaA4D8gQ6AEISDAG Zur Frage der Integration der Zigeuner in der Bundesrepublik Deutschland: eine Untersuchung der gegenwärtigen Situation der Zigeuner und der sozialpolitischen und sozialarbeiterischen Massnahmen für Zigeuner], self-published doctoral thesis, p. 188 #*: ''Aber daß sie sich da mit uns unterhalten, das tun die nicht, mal grad die '''wo''' wir mal kennen, das ist eine Familie (...)'' #*:: But that they should have a chat with us, they don't do that, just maybe those '''who''' we know a bit, that's one family (...) #* '''1994''', Burkhard Hergesell, [https://books.google.de/books?id=SjsiAQAAIAAJ&q=ein+typ+wo&dq=ein+typ+wo&hl=de&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwi8hJfhnPjiAhWHI1AKHTovBk44ChDoAQgyMAM Arbeiterkulturen im Betrieb: interethnische Beziehungen zwischen Produktionsarbeitern: eine empirische Studie], IKO Verlag für Interkulturelle Kommunikation, p. 133 #*: ''Ali: "Und der Hussein, der ist ein Typ, '''wo''' / wo doch nicht Türkisch redet. Der redet nur Deutsch mit mir. (...)"'' #*:: Ali: "And Hussein, he's a bloke '''who''' / who won't speak Turkish. He only talks German to me. (...)" #* '''2009''', {{w|Elfriede Jelinek}}, [https://books.google.de/books?id=bcMLAQAAMAAJ&q=bin+der+wo&dq=bin+der+wo&hl=de&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwj7vu3FpvjiAhXKa8AKHRI_CecQ6AEIMzAC Die Kontrakte des Kaufmanns. Rechnitz (Der Würgeengel). Über Tiere. – Drei Romane], Rowohlt Taschenbuch, p. 216 #*: ''Ich bin, der ich bin. Ich bin, wo ich bin. Ich bin der, '''wo''' ich bin. Wo sagt man sowas?'' #*:: I am who I am. I am where I am. I am the one '''that''' I am. Where do they say it like this? ====Usage notes==== * This use is restricted to dialectally influenced vernaculars ({{m|de|Regiolekt|Regiolekte}}) and chiefly to Alemannic areas (Switzerland and south-western Germany). In other regions, this usage is unusual, and scorned by some. ===Related terms=== * {{l|de|woanders}}, {{l|de|wobei}} ---- ==German Low German== ===Etymology 1=== From {{inh|nds-de|gml|wô|t=how}}, from {{inh|nds-de|osx}}, from {{inh|nds-de|gem-pro|*hwō}}. Cognate with {{cog|en|how}}, {{cog|de|wie}}, {{cog|nl|hoe}}. ====Alternative forms==== * {{qualifier|in some dialects}} {{l|nds-de|woans}} ====Pronunciation==== * {{a|in some dialects}} {{IPA|nds-de|/vɔu̯/}} * {{a|traditional}} {{IPA|nds-de|[wɔʊ̯]}} ====Adverb==== {{head|nds-de|adverb}} # [[how]] #: {{ux|nds-de|'''Wo''' vele Daag?|'''How''' many days?}} ===Etymology 2=== From {{inh|nds-de|osx|hwē}}, from {{inh|nds-de|gem-pro|*hwaz}}. Compare {{cog|en|[[who]], [[whom]], [[whose]]}}. ====Pronoun==== {{head|nds-de|pronoun}} # {{lb|nds-de|Low Prussian|relative}} [[who]], [[which]] #: {{lb|nds-de|Low Prussian}} {{ux|nds-de|Dat, '''wo''' ös...|that '''which''' is...|inline=1}} ====Usage notes==== The dative form (also used for the accusative) is {{m|nds-de|woom}} ({{m|nds-de|wom}}); the genitive form is {{m|nds-de|woos}} ({{m|nds-de|wos}}). ---- ==Haitian Creole== ===Etymology=== From {{der|ht|fr|haut|t=high}}. ===Adjective=== {{head|ht|adjective}} # [[high]] # [[tall]] ===Adverb=== {{head|ht|adverb}} # [[high]] ====Related terms==== * {{l|ht|wotè}} ---- ==Hunsrik== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|hrx|gmh|wā}}, {{m|gmh|wār}}, from {{inh|hrx|goh|wār}}, {{m|goh|hwār}}, from {{inh|hrx|gem-pro|*hwēr}}, {{m|gem-pro|*hwar}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|hrx|/voː/}} ===Adverb=== {{head|hrx|adverb}} # {{lb|hrx|relative}} [[when]] #: {{ux|hrx|In denne Zeid, '''wo''' alles deirer waar.|In those times '''when''' everything was more expensive.}} ===Pronoun=== {{head|hrx|pronoun}} # {{lb|hrx|relative}} [[who]] #: {{ux|hrx|De Mann, '''wo'''st-du sihst, is mein Fatter.|The man you see is my father.}} #: {{ux|hrx|Die Fraa, '''wo''' uns gerufd hod, siehd aarich bees aus.|The woman '''who''' called us seems pretty angry.}} ===Further reading=== * [https://hunsriqueanoriograndense.wordpress.com/dicionario-werterbuch/ Online Hunsrik Dictionary] ---- ==Japanese== ===Romanization=== {{ja-romaji}} #
